ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Recommend to other students. Good breadth of psychiatric disorders using PET and fMRI techniques.

NSCI 521 is a seminar course covering topics in neuroimaging of psychiatric disorders. Each week, we read papers with an expert in the field, usually focusing on results from a single imaging method. This course would be great as an introduction to neuropsychiatry and/or neuroimaging, but is also well-suited for specialists because of the opportunity to do close reading of current literature. I would particularly recommend this course to biomedical scientists wishing to do translational work, because it provided valuable insight into the brain processes underlying psychiatric conditions in humans. It would also be great for medical students or clinicians wishing to enhance their knowledge of the basic science.
Good if you like reading and discussing primary literature papers

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: My dissertation involves using the methods described in the course.
Very helpful for building a foundation
